videos.alt_text: adidas - Your Future Is Not Mine
videos.title: adidas - Your Future Is Not Mine (2016)
videos.description: The 2016 Adidas commercial "Your Future is Not Mine," directed by Terence Neale, features influential creatives like Aleali May, Luka Sabbat, and Iman Shumpert, among others, who march confidently towards an optimistic future, challenging the preconceived notions of a dystopian tomorrow. This campaign, produced by the advertising agency Johannes Leonardo, emphasizes individual empowerment and the message that one's future is theirs to create, rallying viewers to defy negative expectations and shape their own destinies through creativity and personal initiative.
videos.director: Exile Edit, Nate Gross, Shane Reid
videos.additional_info:

This campaign, produced by the advertising agency Johannes Leonardo, emphasizes individual empowerment and the message that one's future is theirs to create, rallying viewers to defy negative expectations and shape their own destinies through creativity and personal initiative.

videos.title: TID Exploring Time 005 by Builders Club (2017)
videos.additional_info:
TID Exploring Time 005 by Builders Club (2017)
'It's an observation of a moment in time and what happens to our mind when we let go and start drifting away. Something ordinary suddenly becomes the impulse for our imagination and we find ourselves wondering where reality ends and imagination starts. Only to wake up realising that it was only relativity playing with us.' videos.title: Flatbush ZOMBiES - Afterlife (2020)
videos.description: The music video for Flatbush Zombies' "Afterlife," produced by James Blake, is notable for its unique visual approach that features an eerie X-ray effect. This creative decision casts the group members and various elements within the video, such as strippers and guns, in a ghostly, skeletal form, aligning with the group's name and adding a macabre twist to typical rap video imagery. The video was directed by Arnaud Bresson, who, alongside a post-production team, developed a technical device to achieve this X-ray effect without endangering anyone, as no technology exists that can safely film living beings in this way. The process involved multi-camera tracking to record the positions and movements of characters, which were then applied to 3D compositions. This painstaking effort took four months to perfect, but the result effectively complements the song's menacing vibe and the group's exploration of nihilistic themes.
